intro: Galium scioanum var. latum, commonly known as broadleaf woodypath, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium scioanum var. latum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
